trans-unit.source: How to configure Google authentication for your App Services application
trans-unit.target: How to configure Google authentication for your App Services application

trans-unit.source: Learn how to configure Google authentication for your App Services application.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to configure Google authentication for your App Services application.

trans-unit.source: How to configure your App Service application to use Google login
trans-unit.target: How to configure your App Service application to use Google login

trans-unit.source: This topic shows you how to configure Azure App Service to use Google as an authentication provider.
trans-unit.target: This topic shows you how to configure Azure App Service to use Google as an authentication provider.

trans-unit.source: To complete the procedure in this topic, you must have a Google account that has a verified email address.
trans-unit.target: To complete the procedure in this topic, you must have a Google account that has a verified email address.

trans-unit.source: To create a new Google account, go to [accounts.google.com](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=268302).
trans-unit.target: To create a new Google account, go to [accounts.google.com](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=268302).

trans-unit.source: This topic demonstrates use of the App Service Authentication / Authorization feature.
trans-unit.target: This topic demonstrates use of the App Service Authentication / Authorization feature.

trans-unit.source: This replaces the App Service gateway for most applications.
trans-unit.target: This replaces the App Service gateway for most applications.

trans-unit.source: Differences that apply to using the gateway are called out in notes throughout the topic.
trans-unit.target: Differences that apply to using the gateway are called out in notes throughout the topic.

trans-unit.source: Register your application with Google
trans-unit.target: Register your application with Google

trans-unit.source: Log on to the [Azure portal], and navigate to your application.
trans-unit.target: Log on to the [Azure portal], and navigate to your application.

trans-unit.source: Copy your **URL**.
trans-unit.target: Copy your **URL**.

trans-unit.source: You will use this to configure your Google app.
trans-unit.target: You will use this to configure your Google app.

trans-unit.source: Navigate to the [Google apis](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=268303) website, sign-in with your Google account credentials, click **Create Project**, provide a **Project name**, then click **Create**.
trans-unit.target: Navigate to the [Google apis](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=268303) website, sign-in with your Google account credentials, click **Create Project**, provide a **Project name**, then click **Create**.

trans-unit.source: In the left navigation bar, click **API & Auth**, then under **Social APIs** click **Google+ API** > **Enable API**.
trans-unit.target: In the left navigation bar, click **API & Auth**, then under **Social APIs** click **Google+ API** > **Enable API**.

trans-unit.source: Click **API & Auth** > **Credentials** > **OAuth consent screen**, then select your **Email address**, enter a **Product Name**, and click **Save**.
trans-unit.target: Click **API & Auth** > **Credentials** > **OAuth consent screen**, then select your **Email address**, enter a **Product Name**, and click **Save**.

trans-unit.source: In the **Credentials** tab, click **Add credentials** > **OAuth 2.0 client ID**, then select **Web application**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Credentials** tab, click **Add credentials** > **OAuth 2.0 client ID**, then select **Web application**.

trans-unit.source: Paste the App Service **URL** you copied earlier into **Authorized JavaScript Origins**, then paste the **Redirect URI** you copied earlier into **Authorized Redirect URI**.
trans-unit.target: Paste the App Service **URL** you copied earlier into **Authorized JavaScript Origins**, then paste the **Redirect URI** you copied earlier into **Authorized Redirect URI**.

trans-unit.source: The redirect URI is the URL of your application appended with the path, _/.auth/login/google/callback_.
trans-unit.target: The redirect URI is the URL of your application appended with the path, _/.auth/login/google/callback_.

trans-unit.source: For example, `https://contoso.azurewebsites.net/.auth/login/google/callback`.
trans-unit.target: For example, `https://contoso.azurewebsites.net/.auth/login/google/callback`.

trans-unit.source: Make sure that you are using the HTTPS scheme.
trans-unit.target: Make sure that you are using the HTTPS scheme.

trans-unit.source: Then click **Create**.
trans-unit.target: Then click **Create**.

trans-unit.source: If you are using the App Service Gateway instead of the App Service Authentication / Authorization feature, your redirect URL instead uses the gateway URL with the _/signin-google_ path.
trans-unit.target: If you are using the App Service Gateway instead of the App Service Authentication / Authorization feature, your redirect URL instead uses the gateway URL with the _/signin-google_ path.

trans-unit.source: On the next screen, make a note of the values of the client ID and client secret.
trans-unit.target: On the next screen, make a note of the values of the client ID and client secret.

trans-unit.source: The client secret is an important security credential.
trans-unit.target: The client secret is an important security credential.

trans-unit.source: Do not share this secret with anyone or distribute it within a client application.
trans-unit.target: Do not share this secret with anyone or distribute it within a client application.

trans-unit.source: Add Google information to your application
trans-unit.target: Add Google information to your application

trans-unit.source: If using the App Service Gateway, ignore this section and instead navigate to your gateway in the portal.
trans-unit.target: If using the App Service Gateway, ignore this section and instead navigate to your gateway in the portal.

trans-unit.source: Select **Settings**, **Identity**, and then **Google**.
trans-unit.target: Select **Settings**, **Identity**, and then **Google**.

trans-unit.source: Paste in the values you obtained earlier and click **Save**.
trans-unit.target: Paste in the values you obtained earlier and click **Save**.

trans-unit.source: Back in the [Azure portal], navigate to your application.
trans-unit.target: Back in the [Azure portal], navigate to your application.

trans-unit.source: Click **Settings**, and then **Authentication / Authorization**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Settings**, and then **Authentication / Authorization**.

trans-unit.source: If the Authentication / Authorization feature is not enabled, turn the switch to **On**.
trans-unit.target: If the Authentication / Authorization feature is not enabled, turn the switch to **On**.

trans-unit.source: Click **Google**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Google**.

trans-unit.source: Paste in the App ID and App Secret values which you obtained previously, and optionally enable any scopes your application requires.
trans-unit.target: Paste in the App ID and App Secret values which you obtained previously, and optionally enable any scopes your application requires.

trans-unit.source: Then click **OK**.
trans-unit.target: Then click **OK**.

trans-unit.source: By default, App Service provides authentication but does not restrict authorized access to your site content and APIs.
trans-unit.target: By default, App Service provides authentication but does not restrict authorized access to your site content and APIs.

trans-unit.source: You must authorize users in your app code.
trans-unit.target: You must authorize users in your app code.

trans-unit.source: (Optional) To restrict access to your site to only users authenticated by Google, set **Action to take when request is not authenticated** to **Google**.
trans-unit.target: (Optional) To restrict access to your site to only users authenticated by Google, set **Action to take when request is not authenticated** to **Google**.

trans-unit.source: This requires that all requests be authenticated, and all unauthenticated requests are redirected to Google for authentication.
trans-unit.target: This requires that all requests be authenticated, and all unauthenticated requests are redirected to Google for authentication.

trans-unit.source: Click **Save**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Save**.

trans-unit.source: You are now ready to use Google for authentication in your app.
trans-unit.target: You are now ready to use Google for authentication in your app.

trans-unit.source: Related Content
trans-unit.target: Related Content
